intro: Schizaea melanesica, commonly known as the Melanesian clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae and is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a creeping rhizome with erect, spirally arranged leaves that are typically narrow and strap-like. Schizaea melanesica reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its leaves. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
